pull.title: Support block hash alias in console
pull.body:
Add support to use @best or @height instead of block hash in the
RPC console. The approach used is to simply replace those expressions
with the relevant RPC method.

labels.name: UX
labels.description: All about "how to get things done"

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.message:
gui: Support block hash alias in console

Add support to use @best or @height instead of block hash in the
RPC console. The approach used is to simply replace those expressions
with the relevant RPC method.

events.body: Now using `QRegExp`, not sure why it fails to build with `QRegularExpression` since it's (supposedly) available since Qt 5.0.

> Now using `QRegExp`, not sure why it fails to build with `QRegularExpression` since it's (supposedly) available since Qt 5.0.

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/564e1ab0f3dc573bd3ea60a80f6649c361243df9/depends/packages/qt.mk#L99
This is an alternative approach for the GUI change in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16439

Approach ACK d2379e5c8f831abc244616069b6382626d6a6382.

Only `help-console` message provides a user with info about new aliases. The help messages of the affected RPC's still lack these updates, but I think it is OK for the GUI console.

This PR seems preferable than the [2f9f2d66cbada9134238f25aa12691876bdeff6b](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16439/commits/2f9f2d66cbada9134238f25aa12691876bdeff6b) commit from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16439.

rename.from: gui: Support block hash alias in console
rename.to: Support block hash alias in console

events.body: @hebasto I'm not convinced this is a good change. Closing for now and leaving it up for grabs.

comments.body: Would it be better to have "\b@best\b" (and likewise for digits) so you don't replace "bob@bestdomainever.com" in a label or similar?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -410,7 +414,11 @@ void RPCExecutor::request(const QString &command, const WalletModel* wallet_mode
                 "   example:    getblock(getblockhash(0) 1)[tx]\n\n"
 
                 "Results without keys can be queried with an integer in brackets using the parenthesized syntax.\n"
-                "   example:    getblock(getblockhash(0),1)[tx][0]\n\n")));
+                "   example:    getblock(getblockhash(0),1)[tx][0]\n\n"
+
+                "Aliases for block hash can be used."
comments.body:
```suggestion
                "Aliases for block hash can be used.\n"
```
I don't think this warrants adding `QRegExp` to the project
I think `RPCParseCommandLine` would be the proper place to do this.
We already have it. Maybe you are thinking of `QRegularExpression`?
